SENT.plain: A 6-year-old boy had a sudden onset of rupture of an aneurysm of the middle cerebral artery
Narrowing of an artery proximal to the aneurysm was shown on an angiogram taken two days after the rupture
At operation, clipping of the aneurysm prevented further bleeding
This artery thrombosed spontaneously in the postoperative period
The outcome was favourable, and the patient returned to school life
Spontaneous thrombosis of an artery after subarachnoid haemorrhage in children is rare, and thrombosis of aneurysm is very rare
To our knowledge, this is the third reported case of spontaneous thrombosis of a cerebral saccular aneurysm with subarachnoid haemorrhage
